hero.headline: GPT-5.2-Codex Drops: OpenAI's Security-First Coding Model Finds React Vulnerabilities
hero.summary: OpenAI released GPT-5.2-Codex, their most advanced agentic coding model optimized for security and long-horizon work. A researcher using the previous version already discovered three CVEs in React Server Components. The new model scores 56.4% on SWE-Bench Pro and 64% on Terminal-Bench 2.0, with significantly stronger cybersecurity capabilities.
hero.whyItMatters: This marks a fundamental shift in AI coding tools—from 'write code faster' to 'write secure code.' GPT-5.2-Codex's ability to find real-world vulnerabilities in production frameworks like React signals a new era where AI becomes a serious force in defensive security. For prompt engineers, this means integrating security-focused prompting patterns into coding workflows.

topStories.title: Claude in Chrome: Control Your Browser from Claude Code
topStories.summary: Anthropic launched Claude in Chrome beta, enabling Claude Code to directly control your browser. The Chrome extension creates a seamless bridge between terminal-based coding and browser automation, expanding agentic workflows to web-based tasks.

topStories.title: Gemini 3 Flash Now in Gemini CLI: 78% SWE-Bench Score at Lower Cost
topStories.summary: Google rolled out Gemini 3 Flash to Gemini CLI, achieving 78% on SWE-bench Verified—outperforming even Gemini 3 Pro for agentic coding. The model offers Pro-grade capabilities at Flash-tier pricing, ideal for high-frequency dev tasks.

topStories.title: Agent Skills Specification: Community Standard for AI Agent Tool Integration
topStories.summary: The Agent Skills specification emerged as a community-driven standard for how AI agents discover and integrate tools. With 1,740 GitHub stars, it's rapidly becoming the lingua franca for building interoperable agent capabilities across different AI platforms.

topStories.title: Run Your Own AI Cluster at Home with Everyday Devices
topStories.summary: The exo project enables running LLMs across a distributed cluster of everyday devices—phones, laptops, desktops, even watches. With 618 stars today, it's capturing the imagination of developers wanting local AI without expensive hardware.

trendingRepos.name: exo-explore/exo
trendingRepos.description: Run your own AI cluster at home with everyday devices. Distributes LLM inference across phones, laptops, desktops, and even smartwatches for local AI without expensive hardware.

trendingRepos.name: anthropics/claude-code
trendingRepos.description: Agentic coding tool that lives in your terminal. Understands your codebase and helps you code faster through natural language commands. Trending with 337 stars today.

trendingRepos.name: sgl-project/mini-sglang
trendingRepos.description: Minimal implementation of SGLang for understanding structured generation with LLMs. A practical learning resource for developers building agentic systems.

trendingRepos.name: NexaAI/nexa-sdk
trendingRepos.description: Run latest LLMs and VLMs across GPU, NPU, and CPU with PC and mobile support. Compatible with OpenAI gpt-oss, Granite4, Qwen3VL, Gemma 3n and more.

trendingSkills.name: bjw-voice-modeling
trendingSkills.description: Capture a specific writing voice for technical communication, LinkedIn posts, research discussions, and professional correspondence. Useful for maintaining consistent brand voice.

trendingSkills.name: bootstrap-utilities
trendingSkills.description: Assists with Bootstrap utility classes including spacing, margins, padding, display, flexbox, text, color, and border utilities for responsive design.

trendingSkills.name: bootstrap-content
trendingSkills.description: Provides guidance on styling Bootstrap typography, tables, images, figures, and content elements for responsive design patterns.

trendingSkills.name: bootstrap-customize
trendingSkills.description: Support for customizing Bootstrap themes through Sass variable overrides, CSS custom properties, or color mode implementation.

newMcpServers.name: arxiv-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Comprehensive bridge between AI assistants and arXiv's research repository. Search papers with advanced filtering, download and store locally as markdown, and conduct deep research analysis.

newMcpServers.name: kubectl-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Enables AI assistants to interact with Kubernetes clusters via kubectl operations. Manage pods, deployments, services, and debug cluster issues through natural language.

newMcpServers.name: apify-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Access the world's largest marketplace of tools for web scraping, data extraction, and web automation. Extract structured data from social media, e-commerce, search engines, and more.

newMcpServers.name: next-devtools-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Next.js development tools and utilities for AI coding assistants. Provides context about your Next.js project structure, routes, and components.

notableHooks.name: Multi-Session Branch Isolation
notableHooks.description: Creates separate Git branches for parallel Claude Code sessions, isolating changes by session ID. Uses shadow Git indexes to prevent conflicts between simultaneous work streams.

notableHooks.name: Bash Command Validator
notableHooks.description: Python script that validates Bash commands against security rules, blocking dangerous operations like 'grep' in favor of 'rg' and preventing risky patterns. Exit code 2 blocks the tool call.

notableHooks.name: Auto-Approve Documentation Reads
notableHooks.description: Automatically approves Read tool calls for documentation files (.md, .mdx, .txt, .json) without prompting, streamlining research workflows while maintaining security for code files.

tuiTools.name: lazygit
tuiTools.description: Simple terminal UI for git commands. The gold standard for git TUIs with vim-like keybindings, interactive staging, and beautiful diffs.

tuiTools.name: posting
tuiTools.description: A powerful HTTP client that lives in your terminal. Built with Textual (Python), perfect for API development without leaving the command line.

tuiTools.name: rainfrog
tuiTools.description: Database management TUI for Postgres, MySQL, and SQLite. Query, browse, and manage databases with a beautiful ratatui-powered interface.

tuiTools.name: harlequin
tuiTools.description: The SQL IDE for your terminal. Full-featured database client with syntax highlighting, autocomplete, and query history.

notableQuotes.quote: A security researcher using GPT-5.1-Codex-Max uncovered multiple previously unknown vulnerabilities while investigating React Server Components, leading to the discovery of CVE-2025-55183, CVE-2025-55184, and CVE-2025-67779.
notableQuotes.author: OpenAI

notableQuotes.quote: Gemini 3 Flash achieves a SWE-bench Verified score of 78% for agentic coding, outperforming not only the 2.5 series, but also Gemini 3 Pro—at Flash-tier pricing for high-frequency dev tasks.
notableQuotes.author: Google Developers

notableQuotes.quote: When measuring AI ability to complete long tasks, Opus 4.5 demonstrates substantial task horizon length—maintaining quality across extended reasoning chains that previous models struggled with.
notableQuotes.author: METR

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 7 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
